title: Contributing to pokehelperr
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/pokehelperr", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to pokehelperr
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: pokehelperr-vignette
text: Pokehelperr R package designed assist Pokémon players building teams pokémon. Users can provide list pokémon currently team, Pokehelperr make suitable recommendation pokémon can strengthen current team balancing ’s overall weaknesses resistances. Given list five pokémon currently team, pokehelpyer determine types team weak types team resistant . Based information, pokehelpyer recommend pokémon added current team make weaknesses resistances balanced. use Pokehelperr project, first import package shown : Pokehelperr currently includes five different functions can used explore resistances weaknesses pokémon team. Using functions effectively can help us build strong team pokémon.

title: pokehelperr-vignette
text: get_types function takes input list pokémon currently team determines type pokémon using existing dataset. Please note pokémon dual types pokémon single type. Hence, output list character vectors inner list contain type(s) pokémon. example , Pikachu, Eevee, Metapod single-type pokémon, whereas Charizard dual-type pokémon.

title: pokehelperr-vignette
text: type pokémon weak resistant attacks certain types pokémon. example, fire-type pokémon weak water-type attacks resistant bug-type attacks. complicated bit dual-types pokémon. dual-typed pokemon can doubly weak doubly resistant certain types. example double weakness, Abomasnow, ice-type grass-type, result doubly weak fire-type attacks. example double resistance Skarmory, steel-type flying-type, result doubly resistant bug-type attacks grass-type attacks. , dual-typed pokemon can weakness cancel resistance. example, can consider Skarmory yet . Flying-type pokemon weak rock-type ice-type attacks, steel-type pokemon resistant rock-type ice-type attacks. result, Skarmory takes normal damage rock-type ice-type attacks. input calc_weaknesses / calc_resistances list lists strings contains types pokémon team (.e. output get_types). functions calculate measure weak / resistant team pokemon type game. output dictionary whose keys 18 types game whose values integers measuring level weakness / resistance team type. Higher values indicate higher level weakness / resistance type (key).
code: team_weaknesses <- calc_weaknesses(team_types) team_resistances <- calc_resistances(team_types)  print('Weaknesses : ') #> [1] "Weaknesses : " team_weaknesses #>   Normal     Fire    Water Electric    Grass      Ice Fighting   Poison  #>        0        1        1        1        0        0        1        0  #>   Ground   Flying  Psychic      Bug     Rock    Ghost   Dragon     Dark  #>        1        1        0        0        3        0        0        0  #>    Steel    Fairy  #>        0        0  print('Resistances : ') #> [1] "Resistances : " team_resistances #>   Normal     Fire    Water Electric    Grass      Ice Fighting   Poison  #>        0        1        0        1        3        0        2        0  #>   Ground   Flying  Psychic      Bug     Rock    Ghost   Dragon     Dark  #>        4        1        0        2        0        3        0        0  #>    Steel    Fairy  #>        2        1

title: pokehelperr-vignette
text: Since recommend function uses information dictionaries created calc_weaknesses calc_resistances determine pokemon added existing team make “balanced”, must first define metric measure “balanced” team . end, use following: \(=1,2,\dots, 18\), let \(w_i\) value corresponding \(\) -th pokemon type dictionary returned calc_weaknesses let \(r_i\) value corresponding \(\) -th pokemon type dictionary returned calc_resistances. Now define \(\delta_i = r_i - w_i\). \(\delta_i < 0\), team weak (overall) pokemon type \(\), definitely considered. negative \(\delta_i\) , problematic. example, player used team 5 fire type pokemon, \(\delta_{\text{water}}\) equal -5, big problem. \(\delta_i > 0\), team resistant (overall) pokemon type \(\), good thing. positive better, value greater zero good. Hence, penalize negative \(\delta_i\) values reward positive \(\delta_i\) values. define type-advantage, \(TA\), corresponding \(\) -th type piecewise function \(\delta_i\). particular, \(TA_i = -(-\delta_i)^{\frac{3}{2}}\) \(\delta_i < 0\) \(TA_i = \delta_i^{\frac{3}{4}}\) \(\delta_i \geq 0\). \(TA\) function penalizes large negative values \(\delta_i\) much penalizes small negative values. flip side, reward large positive values \(\delta_i\) much rewards small positive values. Finally, define balance metric team follows: \(balance = \sum_iTA_i\). Higher values balance indicate well-balanced teams, lower values indicate teams use improvement. calc_balance function takes dictionaries returned calc_weaknesses calc_resistances input, returns balance resulting calculations.

title: pokehelperr-vignette
text: goal recommend function following: "given input list 5 pokemon, determine pokemon added team maximize 'balance' metric". accomplished via simple brute-force search since total number pokemon available large (~700). Let’s try giving recommend team five fire-type pokémon. Since team weak water-type rock-type attacks, expect recommend return pokémon resists water-type rock-type attacks. Skarmory doubly-resistant rock-type attacks (normally) resistant water-type attacks. hand, Ferrothorn doubly-resistant water-type attacks (normally) resistant rock-type attacks. Adding either pokemon team five fire-types definitely help improve team’s balance. Looks like function working expected!!
code: fire_team = list('Charmander', 'Torchic', 'Vulpix', 'Flareon', 'Chimchar') recommend(fire_team, n_recommendations=2) #> [1] "Iteration number 1 of 692." #> [1] "Iteration number 100 of 692." #> [1] "Iteration number 200 of 692." #> [1] "Iteration number 300 of 692." #> [1] "Iteration number 400 of 692." #> [1] "Iteration number 500 of 692." #> [1] "Iteration number 600 of 692." #> [1] "Skarmory"   "Ferrothorn"

what: Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
title: Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
text: pokehelperr R package designed assist Pokémon players building teams pokémon. Users can provide list pokémon currently team, pokehelperr recommend suitable pokémon add team based current team’s overall weaknesses resistances. Pokémon game, players battle using teams six pokémon. pokémon type, grass, water, fire. type game either weak , resistant , neutrally effected type game. player consider weaknesses resistances creating team pokémon, may find scenario consistently struggling win battles certain types pokémon. simple example, player use team six fire type pokémon, likely struggle win battles water type pokémon. preceding obviously extreme example, competitive setting even small imbalance team’s weaknesses resistances can cause major issues player. pokehelperr package aims assist players avoiding imbalances weaknesses/resistances building pokémon team. Given list five pokémon currently team, pokehelperr determine types team weak types team resistant . Based information, pokehelperr reccomend pokémon added current team make weaknesses resistances balanced. (reading aren’t familiar Pokémon, might helpful note “pokémon” singular plural form word, also lowercase “pokémon” refers individual character game, Pikachu, whereas capitalized “Pokémon” refers franchise/game.)

title: Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
text: get_types: Given list pokémon names, determine types pokémon using existing dataset. calc_resistances: Given list pokémon types present player’s team, calculate measure resistant team type game. Creates list names 18 types game, values integers measuring level resistance input team type. Higher values indicate higher level resistance type. calc_weaknesses: Given list pokémon types present player’s team, calculate measure weak team type game. Creates list names 18 types game, values integers measuring level weakness input team type. Higher values indicate higher level weakness type. recommend: Given team 5 pokémon, recommend pokémon added current team make weaknesses resistances balanced. Determines types team resistant weak via calc_resistances calc_weaknesses, makes recommendation based information. particular, uses calc_balance together brute-force search ~700 pokémon determine recommendation based objective maximizing balance. calc_balance: Calculate measure balanced pokémon team using weaknesses resistances. Higher values indicate balanced team.

title: Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
text: pokémon.csv: Dataset containing details pokémon including name, type(s), base stats. type_chart.csv: Dataset containing details abouts weaknesses strengths type pokémon.

title: Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
text: websites applications help build pokémon teams, Mariland Team Builder. However tools simply present player visual representation current team’s weaknesses resistances. don’t make recommendations. words, existing tools simply given visual representations dictionaries created calc_weaknesses calc_resistances. doesn’t seem existing R packages use weaknesses/resistances data make reccomendations additional team members.

title: Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
Assists in building teams of pokémon based on weaknesses and resistances.
text: installing package, please follow instructions :  get_types:  calc_weaknesses calc_resistances:  calc_balance:  recommend:
code: library(pokehelperr) team_types <- get_types(list('Pikachu', 'Eevee', 'Charizard', 'Metapod')) team_types team_weaknesses <- calc_weaknesses(team_types) team_resistances <- calc_resistances(team_types) team_balance <- calc_balance(     resistances=team_resistances,      weaknesses=team_weaknesses ) fire_team = list('Charmander', 'Torchic', 'Vulpix', 'Flareon', 'Chimchar') recommend(fire_team, n_recommendations=2)

title: calc_balance — calc_balance
text: Calculate measure balanced team using weaknesses resistances. Higher values indicate balanced team.

title: calc_balance — calc_balance
text: resistances: list resistances obtained calc_resistances weaknesses: list weaknesses obtained calc_weaknesses

title: calc_balance — calc_balance
text: balance : float measure balanced team .

title: calc_resistances — calc_resistances
text: Given list pokémon types present player's team, calculate measure resistant team type game. Creates list names 18 types game, values integers measuring level resistance input team type. Higher values indicate higher level resistance type (name).

title: calc_resistances — calc_resistances
text: team_list list Pokemon types.

title: calc_resistances — calc_resistances
text: resistance_list list Pokemon names integers team type values.

title: calc_resistances — calc_resistances
code: calc_resistances(list(list("Electric"), list("Fire", "Flying"))) #> Error in calc_resistances(list(list("Electric"), list("Fire", "Flying"))): Input should be a list of character vectors of pokemon types.

title: calc_weaknesses — calc_weaknesses
text: Given list pokémon types present player's team, calculate measure weak team type game. Creates list keys 18 types game, values integers measuring level weakness input team key (type). Higher values indicate higher level weakness type.

title: calc_weaknesses — calc_weaknesses
text: team_list : list list strings list pokémon types associated user's team obtained via get_types

title: calc_weaknesses — calc_weaknesses
text: weaknesses : list list containing 18 pokémon types integers measuring level weakness input team type values.

title: calc_weaknesses — calc_weaknesses
code: calc_weaknesses(list(list("Electric"), list("Fire", "Flying"))) #> Error in calc_weaknesses(list(list("Electric"), list("Fire", "Flying"))): Input should be a list of character vectors of pokemon types.

title: get_types — get_types
text: Given list pokémon names, determine types pokémon using existing dataset. Creates list pokemon types matching pokemon names names dataset getting corresponding type(s) pokemon. pokemon names cleaned looking match.

title: get_types — get_types
text: pokemon_names list pokemon names users team

title: get_types — get_types
text: pokemon_types list strings pokémon types corresponding pokémon names input list

title: get_types — get_types

title: recommend — recommend
text: Given team 5 pokémon, recommend pokémon added current team make weaknesses resistances balanced. function first determines types team weak types team resistant via calc_resistances calc_weaknesses, makes recommendation based information.

text: current_team: list strings list 5 pokémon names

title: recommend — recommend
text: recommendation: string name pokémon added input team make weaknesses resistances balanced.
